content.question: In lines 11-20, the speaker imagines a future moment of conflict between the beloved and the “rival fools” that serves to

choices.label: warn the beloved not to be too free with her affections
promise that he will be willing to compete with the rival fools
predict that the rival fools will be responsible for his decline
assert that the beloved will remain true to him

content.answer: assert that the beloved will remain true to him

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the function of conflict in a text.
